CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. phthalimide
2. polythiophene

Explanation:

1. Phthalimide: This is the name of the material used in the OFETs (organic field-effect transistors) mentioned in the paragraph.
2. Polythiophene: This is the name of the organic material used in the OFETs, which contains phthalimide.

So, the two material names mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. Phthalimide
2. Polythiophene
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph, after removing irrelevant entities:

1. Phthalimide
2. Polythiophene

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Phthalimide |
| Polythiophene |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that OFETs based on a phthalimide - containing polythiophene exhibited hole mobilities of ∼ 0.2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions without optimization.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. "OFETs" - stands for "Organic Field-Effect Transistors"
2. "phthalimide" - a type of organic molecule used in the structure of the OFETs
3. "polythiophene" - a type of organic molecule used in the structure of the OFETs
4. "hole mobility" - a property of the OFETs that refers to the speed at which holes (positive charge carriers) can move through the material
5. "ambient conditions" - refers to the standard conditions under which the OFETs were tested, which is room temperature and normal atmospheric pressure.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. "phthalimide" - a type of organic molecule used in the structure of the OFETs
2. "polythiophene" - a type of organic molecule used in the structure of the OFETs
3. "hole mobility" - a property of the OFETs that refers to the speed at which holes (positive charge carriers) can move through the material

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| phthalimide |
| polythiophene |
| hole mobility |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

2. 0.2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
